cogs.commands package#

Submodules#

cogs.commands.analyze module#

class cogs.commands.analyze.Analyze(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is used to handle the analyze command. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“COMMANDS”][“ANALYZE”].

cogs.commands.earnings module#

class cogs.commands.earnings.Earnings(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is used to handle the earnings command. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“COMMANDS”][“EARNINGS”].

async earnings_error(ctx, error)[source]#

Catches the errors when using the !earnings command.

Parameters:

  • ctx (commands.Context) – Necessary Discord context object.

  • error (Exception) – The exception that was raised when using the !earnings command.

cogs.commands.sentiment module#

class cogs.commands.sentiment.Sentiment(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is used to handle the sentiment command. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“COMMANDS”][“SENTIMENT”].

async get_news(ticker)[source]#

Get the latest news for a given stock ticker.

Parameters:

ticker (str) – The stock ticker to get the news for.

Returns:

The latest news for a given stock ticker.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

async sentiment_error(ctx, error)[source]#

Catches the errors when using the !sentiment command.

Parameters:

  • ctx (commands.Context) – The context of the command.

  • error (Exception) – The exception that was raised when using the !sentiment command.

Return type:

None

cogs.commands.stock module#

class cogs.commands.stock.Stock(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class handles the /stock command. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“COMMANDS”][“STOCK”].

update_assets_db(new_db)[source]#

Updates the assets database.

Parameters:

new_db (pandas.DataFrame) – The new database to be written to the assets database.

Return type:

None
